data.title: First National Studios, Burbank, California
data.meta_description: American postcard. Western Air Express, No. 888 'Where Motion Pictures Are Made." 7a-H3656. An overview of the First National Pictures studio complex in the mid-/ late 1920s. First National, which had started out as a cinema exhibitors chain in 1917, and had expanded with film distribution in 1919, opened up production facilities in 1924. When, in 1928-1929, First National was taken over by Warner Bros., the Burbank complex would become Warner's major studio lot. See en.wikipedia.org/wiki/First_National_Pictures
data.text:
American postcard. Western Air Express, No. 888 'Where Motion Pictures Are Made." 7a-H3656. An overview of the First National Pictures studio complex in the mid-/ late 1920s. First National, which had started out as a cinema exhibitors chain in 1917, and had expanded with film distribution in 1919, opened up production facilities in 1924. When, in 1928-1929, First National was taken over by Warner Bros., the Burbank complex would become Warner's major studio lot.

See en.wikipedia.org/wiki/First_National_Pictures
